question: The serum concentration in which of the following human IgG subclasses is maximum?
The immunoglobulin lacking hinge region is
exp: Hinges contribute to flexibility of immunoglobulin molecules. They contain cysteine and proline. Cysteine provides interchain linkage. Proline cannot be incorporated into secondary structure of immunoglobulin molecules. The immunoglobulins Ig M & Ig E lack the hinge region. They have an extra domain in the constant region-Ch4

question: IL-2 is secreted by
exp: IL-2 is a typical four a helix cytokine and is produced primarily by activated CD4+ T cells, although expression by naive CD8+ T cells, dendritic cells, and thymic cells has also been repoed (8, 9, 10, 11). In T cells, IL-2 synthesis is tightly regulated at the m. RNA level by signals from the TCR and CD28 (12).
